answer:
An egg or peanut allergy is not a contraindication to the Measles, Mumps, Rubella (MMR) Vaccine. Individuals with egg or peanut allergies can receive this vaccine.  
Your immunizing health care provider will assess for any contraindications prior to administering a vaccine.  If you have quesitons or concerns about your child receiving a vaccine, it is encouraged that you discuss them with your health care provider. 
- Immunization Nurse
answer_formatted:
## An egg or peanut allergy is not a contraindication to the Measles, Mumps, Rubella (MMR) Vaccine.

Individuals with egg or peanut allergies can receive this vaccine.
Your immunizing health care provider will assess for any contraindications prior to administering a vaccine.
If you have quesitons or concerns about your child receiving a vaccine, it is encouraged that you discuss them with your health care provider.
- Immunization Nurse
question: My child is allergic to eggs and also peanuts , can he get the 12 months shot MMR?
